TopicTitle: Sneak peek at Xbox One version!

Articles.Content:
Polygon just posted this, it's a sneak peek at the upcoming Xbox version of KSP.

I like the orbit lines.
I like the new GUI

I don't expect to be owning a console any time soon, but this makes me happy anyway.

KSP for everyone!

He must be using a keyboard and mouse on that Xbox One. Also, this could serve as an early 1.1 demo! Lots of little features that only 1.1 has (orbits, gui).

Has it been discussed whether the console versions will have mod support? If yes, how will that be accomplished? I'm hoping for some sort of easy-to-use GUI store-like site that auto-updates, and that will also be available to PC users. With Kerbalstuff gone, and CKAN kind of a kludge, an official mod store that handles installation and updates would be awesome and about f'ing time.

If no, that just makes me sad.

I don't think he is using a keyboard and mouse.  You can tell by the pointer movements, especially in the VAB, that he is attempting to do it using an analog pad and at times struggles, overshooting his button.  I have a feeling this is the area that consoles (other than Wii U assuming the touch screen is good) will have the hardest time with.

Edited February 18, 2016 by Alshain
Good video. Can't wait till it's ready for consoles. I'll be getting it for PS4.
I like how they didn't change the game ex. make it a simplified version.
I hope to god you guys decide to limit the FPS... it's gonna be jarring going from an assumed 60 to a crawling 18 to 20fps whenever there's heavy alphas on screen.
Besides a few graphical reductions and possibly some lower frame rates, it seems to be pretty much the same game as the PC edition.

5 hours ago, capran said:

Has it been discussed whether the console versions will have mod support? If yes, how will that be accomplished?

Microsoft and Sony have 'mod' platforms coming up for their XBLM and PSN stores respectively, Fallout 4 (via the GECK) is slated to be the first game to use them (although Sony has also said FFXIV is also going to get mod support).

It is a bit worrying though that Bethesda says the support is coming, but there basically hasn't been anything from MS or Sony about it in quite a while

Anyway, sidetracked, if (when) mod support arrives for consoles, maybe Squad can hook KSP into it as well (but they'd be crazy to even suggest the possibility until they know exactly how they're going to work, like how they'll be curated, what Squad would need to do to ensure mods couldn't break the games sandbox, what it'll cost to have KSP mod enabled etc).

3 hours ago, AquaAlmond Productions said:

I like how they didn't change the game ex. make it a simplified version.

Me too. I'm excited I will get a real KSP experience.

 

Also, your YouTube videos look cool. I subscribed to you and will be checking out your videos.

7 hours ago, ForsakenVoyager said:

Me too. I'm excited I will get a real KSP experience.

 

Also, your YouTube videos look cool. I subscribed to you and will be checking out your videos.

Thanks, I'm going to be uploading sometime today.

Edited February 19, 2016 by AquaAlmond Productions
We need BIGGER Kerbal portraits!  And please remove all numbers from the game and replace them with bars or no info at all!
Can anyone confirm if this is the final version of the XBOX1 version? The fact that the game is running in the yellow with only 75 parts is concerning and should be discussed.

Just now, Majorjim said:

Can anyone confirm if this is the final version of the XBOX1 version? The fact that the game is running in the yellow with only 75 parts is concerning and should be discussed.

 

@ ~55 seconds he said the developers told him they wanted to try to get it out before E3.

E3 is in June so I seriously doubt it is even close to final.

6 minutes ago, Majorjim said:

The fact that the game is running in the yellow with only 75 parts is concerning and should be discussed.

Unfortunately, consoles aren't going to be able to handle the game without some serious optimizations and some compromises. I feel like it's not going to be that enjoyable on console, but I guess we'll see.

Just now, Alshain said:

 

@ ~55 seconds he said the developers told him they wanted to try to get it out before E3.

E3 is in June so I seriously doubt it is even close to final.

Possibly. Why no info with the video if it is running slower than the retail version will though? I have never seen a developer show an early game version and not say something like 'this is not indicative of final experience' ect.

 

Just now, Sequinox said:

Unfortunately, consoles aren't going to be able to handle the game without some serious optimizations and some compromises. I feel like it's not going to be that enjoyable on console, but I guess we'll see.

I understand that there will be compromises but it looks like the game will run in slow motion the entire time if the timer flickers green/yellow even with a single kerbal EVA in Kerbin 'orbit'. It was solid yellow (slow motion) with only 75 parts.

Honestly, it really doesn't look very fun to manuever that cursor around with the analog stick... Things like transferring fuel or crew must be super tedious.

1 hour ago, Majorjim said:

Can anyone confirm if this is the final version of the XBOX1 version? The fact that the game is running in the yellow with only 75 parts is concerning and should be discussed.

Agreed, he said there is no difference, but im betting that the Xbox1 version will have reduced graphics or something, and there as it stands needs to be major optimization for it to be ready for the console

I think using the joystick as a virtual mouse was just an easy way to get the same game working on a console without redesigning the UI.

You would want to use tabs for selecting everything in the UI for a gamepad only game rather than moving a virtual mouse to click a button. I'm sure this was discussed and this was the best compromise.
